item.title: 特朗普呼吁美联储降息，称 "几乎所有商品 "的价格都在下跌
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二再次呼吁美联储降低利率，并称汽油、日用品和 "几乎所有其他东西 "的价格都在下降。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday repeated his call for the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates, saying prices for gas, groceries and "practically everything else" are down.】

item.title: 对冲基金在中美贸易协议引发的涨势中收益甚微
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）周二的一份报告显示，周一中美达成关税协议引发华尔街股市大涨，全球对冲基金从中获得的收益有限。【原文：Global hedge funds reaped limited gains from a big Wall Street stock rally triggered by a U.S.-China agreement on tariffs on Monday, a Morgan Stanley note on Tuesday showed.】

item.title: 科佩克称中国纸浆市场面临美国关税挑战
item.description: 智利工业企业集团 Empresas Copec 周二表示，如果造纸企业在美国关税政策的不确定性下努力提高销售额，那么其林业产品的中国市场可能会变得更具挑战性。【原文：Chilean industrial conglomerate Empresas Copec said on Tuesday that the Chinese market for its forestry products could become more challenging if paper makers struggle to boost sales amid uncertainty over U.S. tariff policies.】

item.title: 英特尔首席财务官称客户对最新芯片制造技术的承诺有限
item.description: 英特尔公司财务总监大卫-津斯纳（David Zinsner）周二表示，英特尔公司利用即将推出的制造技术为外部客户生产的处理器数量目前 "并不多"。【原文：The volume of processors Intel is set to produce for external customers using its upcoming manufacturing technology is currently "not significant", finance chief David Zinsner said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司高管称，该公司可能要到 2027 年或 28 年才能获得波音 737 MAX 10 型飞机
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）的一位高管周二表示，由于波音737 MAX 10何时获批使用尚不确定，该公司可能要到2027年或2028年才能接收该飞机。【原文：United Airlines may not take delivery of the Boeing 737 MAX 10 until 2027 or 2028 because of uncertainty about when the plane will be approved for use, an executive for the carrier said Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧盟报告显示，俄罗斯经济状况比莫斯科说的更糟
item.description: 斯德哥尔摩转型经济研究所（SITE）周二发布的一份报告称，由于向战争模式的转变以及西方对莫斯科入侵乌克兰的制裁，俄罗斯经济正处于日益不稳定的状态。【原文：The Russian economy is in an increasingly precarious state as a result of a shift to a war mode and of Western sanctions over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine, a report by the Stockholm Institute of Transition Economics (SITE) said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 从高管被杀到网络攻击，UnitedHealth 一波三折
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）首席执行官安德鲁-威蒂（Andrew Witty）意外卸任，公司资深人士斯蒂芬-赫姆斯利（Stephen Hemsley）将重返高层，带领这家医疗保健集团度过最具挑战性的时期之一。【原文：UnitedHealth Group CEO Andrew Witty has stepped down unexpectedly and company veteran Stephen Hemsley is returning to the top role to steer the healthcare conglomerate through one of its most challenging periods.】

item.title: 大众品牌首席执行官告诉英国《金融时报》，德国削减成本的行动使工厂成本下降了 13
item.description: 大众品牌首席执行官托马斯-舍费尔（Thomas Schaefer）在周二举行的一次会议上告诉《金融时报》，大众去年 12 月与工会签署的德国成本削减计划迄今已使工厂成本平均削减了 13%。【原文：Volkswagen's cost-cutting programme in Germany, signed off with unions last December, has so far led to an average cut in factory costs of 13%, brand CEO Thomas Schaefer told the Financial Times at a conference on Tuesday.】

item.title: Verizon 未来 5 年将向美国小企业供应商投资 50 亿美元
item.description: Verizon 周二表示，将在未来五年内向美国的小企业供应商投资 50 亿美元，以促进国内供应链的发展。【原文：Verizon said on Tuesday it would invest $5 billion over the next five years in small business suppliers in the U.S. with the goal of boosting domestic supply chains.】

item.title: 赫兹季度业绩不及华尔街预期，股价暴跌
item.description: 赫兹全球公司（Hertz Global）周二股价下跌超过 20%，原因是该公司因车队减少和预订量放缓而导致业绩未达华尔街预期。【原文：Shares of Hertz Global fell more than 20% on Tuesday after the rental car company's results missed Wall Street expectations due to reduced vehicle fleet and a moderation in bookings.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，美国考虑让阿联酋购买超过一百万片先进的英伟达芯片
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，特朗普政府正在权衡一项协议，该协议将允许阿联酋进口超过一百万片先进的英伟达芯片，这一数量远远超过了拜登时代人工智能芯片法规的限制。【原文：The Trump administration is weighing a deal that would allow the UAE to import more than a million advanced Nvidia chips, a quantity that far exceeds limits under Biden-era AI chip regulations, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 开云集团首席执行官称美国消费面临下降
item.description: Gucci 的所有者开云集团（Kering）首席执行官弗朗索瓦-亨利-皮诺（Francois-Henri Pinault）周二在议会听证会上告诉法国参议员，美国对其奢侈品和时尚产品的需求急剧下降。【原文：Gucci-owner Kering has seen a stark decline of demand for its luxury and fashion goods in the United States, its Chief Executive Francois-Henri Pinault told French senators at a parliamentary hearing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普海湾之行的中心议题是交易
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二从沙特阿拉伯获得了 6000 亿美元的投资承诺，此前这个石油大国在他开始海湾国家之行时为他铺上了红地毯。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump secured a $600 billion commitment from Saudi Arabia on Tuesday to invest in the United States after the oil power rolled out the red carpet for him at the start of a tour of Gulf states.】

item.title: 美联储在贸易战降温和通胀之际保持耐心
item.description: 高于预期的通胀率和中美贸易战的显著缓和缓解了人们对美国家庭和企业在未来数月将遭受巨大挤压的担忧，促使华尔街公司降低了对经济衰退的预测，并为美联储维持利率不变提供了空间。【原文：Tamer-than-expected inflation and a significant de-escalation of a U.S.-China trade war are easing fears of a sharp squeeze on American households and businesses in coming months, prompting Wall Street firms to pare predictions of a recession and giving the Federal Reserve room to leave interest rates where they are.】

item.title: 纽约联储：第一季度学生贷款问题激增
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行（Federal Reserve Bank of New York）周二发布的一份报告称，在政府取消 COVID-19 大流行期间实施的长期暂停还债令后，美国学生贷款借款人在第一季度遇到了麻烦。【原文：U.S. student loan borrowers ran into trouble during the first quarter after the government lifted a long-running moratorium on debt repayment implemented during the COVID-19 pandemic, a report from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Nutresa 向墨西哥 Alsea 公司出售哥伦比亚星巴克特许经营权股份
item.description: 哥伦比亚加工食品公司 Nutresa 表示，已将其持有的该国星巴克特许经营商 30% 的股份出售给墨西哥连锁餐厅 Alsea 的一个部门。【原文：Colombian processed food company Nutresa said it sold its 30% stake in the country's Starbucks franchise operator to a unit of Mexican restaurant chain Alsea .】

item.title: 波音公司四月交付量增长近一倍
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，4 月份共交付了 45 架商用喷气式飞机，几乎是去年同期交付的 24 架飞机的两倍。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday it delivered 45 commercial jets in April, nearly twice the 24 airplanes it delivered during the same month a year ago.】

item.title: 中国财政部表示将从 5 月 14 日起调整对美国商品的关税税率
item.description: 中国财政部周二发表声明称，中国将从周三中午12:01（北京时间4:01）起，在最初的90天内把对美国商品的关税降至10%。【原文：China will lower its tariffs on U.S. goods to 10% for an initial 90 days starting from 12:01 pm (0401 GMT) on Wednesday, Chinese finance ministry said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国消费者金融监督机构建议废除不良行为者登记册
item.description: 美国消费者金融保护局周二向《联邦公报》（Federal Register）提交的一份通知显示，该局正提议取消非银行企业违规者登记册，该登记册是拜登政府为追踪违反消费者法律的公司而设立的。【原文：The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is proposing to do away with a registry of nonbank corporate offenders, which was created under the Biden administration to track companies caught violating consumer laws, according to a notice submitted on Tuesday to the Federal Register.】

item.title: 花旗将向金融科技公司 iCapital 出售财富管理部门
item.description: 华尔街重量级企业花旗集团（Citigroup）与金融科技公司 iCapital 周二宣布，花旗集团已同意将其财富管理部门出售给 iCapital，以简化其业务。【原文：Wall Street heavyweight Citigroup has agreed to sell its wealth alternatives unit to fintech firm iCapital, the companies announced on Tuesday, as the bank pursues simplifying its business.】

item.title: 中美贸易缓和缓解欧盟对中国商品泛滥的担忧
item.description: 欧洲经济专员瓦尔蒂斯-东布罗夫斯基斯（Valdis Dombrovskis）表示，中美贸易紧张局势的缓和是朝着正确方向迈出的一步，有助于减少欧洲对中国商品从美国市场转入欧洲市场的担忧。【原文：The easing of trade tensions between the United States and China is a step in the right direction and helps reduce European fears of being flooded with Chinese goods redirected from the U.S. market, European Economic Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis said.】

item.title: 美联航展示新型 787 内部装饰，力求让纽瓦克乘客放心
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周二发布了新款波音 787 Dreamliners 的升级版内饰，该公司最近几周在其附近的纽瓦克自由国际机场（Newark Liberty International Airport）枢纽发生了一系列问题和数百次航班中断，因此该公司试图让客户放心。【原文：United Airlines on Tuesday is unveiling upgraded interiors on new Boeing 787 Dreamliners as it seeks to reassure customers after a series of issues and hundreds of flight disruptions in recent weeks at its nearby hub of Newark Liberty International Airport.】

item.title: 迪斯尼的 ESPN 流媒体服务每月收费 29.99 美元
item.description: 华特迪士尼周二表示，其新的流媒体服务 ESPN 每月收费 29.99 美元。【原文：Walt Disney said on Tuesday its new streaming service, ESPN, would cost $29.99 per month.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，微软将裁员 3
item.description: 据 CNBC 周二援引 Windows 制造商的一份声明报道，微软正在裁员 3%。【原文：Microsoft is laying off 3% of its workforce, CNBC reported on Tuesday, citing a statement from the Windows maker.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，沙特阿拉伯财富基金将订购 30 架波音喷气机
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道，沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金计划订购 30 架波音 737 MAX 喷气式飞机。【原文：Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund plans to order 30 Boeing 737 MAX jets, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普来访之际，沙特阿拉伯胡曼公司与英伟达公司合作实现人工智能目标
item.description: 美国芯片巨头英伟达（Nvidia）和沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金旗下的人工智能初创公司Humain周二宣布建立合作伙伴关系，这是沙特阿拉伯王国借助外资发展人工智能和加强云计算基础设施计划的一部分。【原文：U.S. chip giant Nvidia and Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund-owned AI startup Humain announced a partnership on Tuesday as part of the kingdom's plans to develop artificial intelligence and strengthen cloud computing infrastructure with the help of foreign investment.】

item.title: 消费者需求保持强劲，中国剑网季度收入超预期
item.description: 周二，中国电子商务零售商京东商城（JD.com）的季度收入超过了市场预期，这表明即使美国加征关税和经济长期疲软对消费者情绪造成影响，市场需求依然稳定。【原文：Chinese e-commerce retailer JD.com topped market estimates for quarterly revenue on Tuesday, in a sign of steady demand even as U.S. tariffs and prolonged economic weakness weighed on consumer sentiment.】

item.title: 美国银行到 2027 年将开设 150 多家新分行
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）周二表示，该行计划在 2027 年底之前新开设 150 多家分行，这也是该行在全美拓展实体业务的努力之一。【原文：Bank of America plans to open more than 150 new branches by the end of 2027, it said on Tuesday, as part of the lender's efforts to expand its physical presence across the United States.】

item.title: 通用汽车和 LG 将为未来的电动汽车制造成本更低的新型电池
item.description: 通用汽车公司和电池合作伙伴 LG Energy Solution 周二表示，双方计划从 2028 年开始在美国的一家工厂为未来的电动汽车商业化生产成本更低的电池。【原文：General Motors and battery partner LG Energy Solution are planning to start commercial production of lower-cost cells for future electric vehicles at a U.S. facility starting in 2028, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国贸易谈判代表称 10%的普遍关税将重建国内制造业
item.description: 美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）周二表示，美国将继续对进入美国的商品征收10%的普遍关税，但美国官员正在与许多国家进行谈判，以降低唐纳德-特朗普总统征收的额外关税。【原文：U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Tuesday a 10% universal tariff on goods entering the United States would stay in place but U.S. officials were in talks with many countries to lower additional tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.】
